groupHeaders: Please indicate the intensity of current, best, and worst pain levels over the past 24 hours on a scale of 0 (no pain) to 10 (worst pain imaginable)
instructions: The patient is asked to make three pain ratings, corresponding to current, best, and worst pain experienced over the past 24 hours. The average of the 3 ratings is used to represent the patientâ€™s level of pain over the previous 24 hours. Please ask your patient to respond to all three pain ratings.
mcid_mdc:
MCID = Minimally Clinically Important Difference, MDC = Minimal Detectable Change

Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain: MCID = 1 point or 15% change.
Shoulder Pain: MCID = 2.2 points.
Chronic Pain (including fibromyalgia, diabetic neuropathy, post-herpetic neuralgia, chronic low back pain, and osteoarthritis): MCID = 1.7 points or 27.9% change.
Chronic Spinal Cord Injury: MCID = 1.8 points or 36% change.
Post-Operative: MCID = 35% reduction on the NPRS (minimal relief), 67% reduction on the NPRS (moderate relief), 70% reduction on the NPRS (much relief), 94% reduction on the NPRS (complete relief).
Hospital/ ER: MCID = 1.3 points.
Brain Injury with Lower Back Pain: MCID = 1.5 points after 1 week of physical therapy; MCID = 2.2 points after 4 weeks of physical therapy; MDC (95% CI) = 2 points.

These are published values for specific populations and provide guidance if the patient does not have the listed condition.
overview: The Numeric Pain Rating Scale (NPRS) measures the subjective intensity of pain.
population: The intended population includes the following conditions: Pain Management and Chronic Pain.
references:

3. Michener LA, Snyder AR, Leggin BG. Responsiveness of the numeric pain rating scale in patients with shoulder pain and the effect of surgical status. J Sport Rehabil. 2011;20(1):115-128. doi:10.1123/jsr.20.1.115

6. Sloman R, Wruble AW, Rosen G, et al. Determination of clinically meaningful levels of pain reduction in patients experiencing acute postoperative pain. Pain Manag Nurs. 2006;7(4):153-158. doi:10.1016/j.pmn.2006.09.001

score_calculation: Average Score = (Current Pain Level + Worst Pain Level + Best Pain Level) /3
score_interpretation:
Cut-off score for overall pain: Mild = 1-3, Moderate = 4-7, and Severe = 8-10.
For worst pain: Mild = 1-3, Moderate = 4-6, and Severe = 7-10.
